instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..

threads.title: MACBOOK RETINA 12" (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / EARLY 2016
threads.message:
This Macbook came in , I found some jelly looking liquid on it  which looks like hand sanitizer inside of it , now when i connect it to the amp meter  , 20v is present , but pulling 0.21 amp and 4.1 watts , and CPU gets super hot under my thermal camera , before i do anything i would love to get some ideas.


Thank you very much.

threads.title: MACBOOK RETINA 12" (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / EARLY 2016
threads.message:
These boards are nightmare.
Considering liquid damge, I don't recommend to waste time on it at all.
You can repair some power issue and finally end with dead CPU.

The worst design from Apple, as no fan installed...
